meanings.definition: A body of Muslim scholars recognized as having specialist knowledge of Islamic sacred law and theology.
meanings.sent1: The ulamas gathered to discuss interpretations of the Quran.
meanings.sent2: The ulamas provided guidance on religious matters to the community.
meanings.sent3: The ulamas had a friendly competition to see who could recite the most verses.
meanings.sent4: The wisdom of the ulamas was a beacon of light in times of confusion.
meanings.sent5: The young students aspired to be like the ulamas, wise and knowledgeable.

meanings.definition: A group of religious scholars or authorities in Islam.
meanings.sent1: In the mosque, the ulamas led the congregation in prayer.
meanings.sent2: The ulamas were respected for their deep understanding of Islamic teachings.
meanings.sent3: The ulamas joked about holding a bake-off to raise funds for charity.
meanings.sent4: The unity among the ulamas was a source of strength for the community.
meanings.sent5: The words of the ulamas resonated with truth and compassion.
